name: Box of Limes
description:
(just a note this is my First Ludum Dare game jam)
Ludum Dare Page: https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/46/box-of-limes

This game is a mix of Tetris and Lemmings you play as a UFO trying to help the Little "Lime" (not a Lemming) to the exit door in each level.

Due to my other puzzle jam games getting criticised about their difficulty due to not having enough time to work on the difficulty curve of the to teach the player. this Ludum Dare i decided to design the levels as i would do if this was just a start of a real full game.

So due to this entry kinda ends just after the introductory levels so sorry about that but this is more so players can play as much of the game as they want to, tell me if you think this was a good or bad idea.

controls:
this game uses a system that you can use both mouse and keyboard controls at the same time, to switch them simply press any keyboard key (apart from M/Space/R) to change to keyboard and click anywhere if you want to use the mouse. ( changeing between these has a cute little animation I'm really proud of. :3 )

keyboard controls:

   Menu:
      Z - enter/select
      Up/Down - move selection up and down

   InGame:
      Left/Right - Move UFO Left and Right
      Up/Down- Rotate Block
      Z - Drop Block
      Enter - pauses the game

Mouse controls:

   Menu:
      Left Click - enter/select
      Swipe up/down - move selection up and down

   InGame:
      Mouse Movement - move UFO Left and Right goes under your mouse
      Left Click - Drop Block
      Right Click- Rotate Block
      Pause button on the top right - pauses the game

   Universal: (are on the keyboard but i couldn't fit them onscreen, but doesn't effect toggling)
      R - Restart
      Space - speed up game speed (doesn't effect blocks)
      M - Mute game (has a cute little animation I'm proud of btw)

as you can likely tell from the graphics of this game I spent a lot of time making things as clean and nice as i can expesaly with all the small little details, think of it of almost a vertical slice of a real game, its more quality than quantity.

Overall I do hope everyone who plays has a nice time with it.
